intro: Cleistanthus minahassae, commonly known as the Minahassa cleistanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It typically grows in lowland forests and is often found in secondary vegetation. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
